page.title: 15Johnstone: Bus Service
page.content: One day we went to the bus garage at Milliken Park. There were 53 buses in the station, 17 of which were long distance coaches. Mr Gordon the depot manager, told us that it costs Â£70,000 for a new double decker coach, but Â£5,000 could buy a reconditioned bus from London Transport. A new window for one costs Â£400. They clean the vehicles every six weeks with a steam cleaner. Each bus has to make on average, Â£1.26 per mile to make a profit. The tyres on the vehicles last only 4000 miles and then they are recut, but these recut ones cannot be used on the front wheels. The buses are at the moment being painted a dark red and bright yellow livery as they are becoming Clydeside Buses; if the Transport Bill is passed all services will be privatised.
